workflow.name: Proactive SLA monitoring & ticket escalation with Zendesk, Slack and Google Sheets
workflow.description:
## Description:
Ensure your customer SLAs never slip with this n8n automation template.
 The workflow runs on a schedule, fetching open tickets from Zendesk, calculating SLA time remaining, and sending proactive alerts to Slack when tickets approach breach thresholds (75% and 90%). It also updates ticket priority in Zendesk and logs compliance metrics to Google Sheets for reporting.
Perfect for support operations, CX teams, and SaaS companies looking to maintain SLA compliance and reduce response delays automatically.

## ‚úÖ What This Template Does (Step-by-Step)
‚è∞ Run Every Hour: Automatically triggers every hour to check for SLA-sensitive tickets.
üì• Fetch All Open Zendesk Tickets: Pulls all tickets via the Zendesk API, returning essential fields: ID, status, created_at, sla_due, and priority.
üîç Filter Only ‚ÄúOpen‚Äù Tickets: Excludes closed, on-hold, or pending tickets ‚Äî monitoring focuses only on actionable cases.
‚è±Ô∏è Calculate SLA Time Remaining: Computes total SLA duration, remaining minutes, and % of SLA consumed for each ticket.
üü° Warn at 75% Threshold: When 75% of the SLA window has passed, automatically sends a Slack warning to the #general-information channel.
üî¥ Escalate at 90% Threshold: For tickets nearing breach (‚â•90%), the workflow updates Zendesk ticket priority to ‚ÄúHigh,‚Äù adds escalation notes, and notifies the support team for immediate action.
üìä Log SLA Compliance in Google Sheets: Each ticket‚Äôs SLA metrics (ID, % elapsed, time remaining, timestamp) are appended to a Google Sheet for tracking and reporting.
‚úÖ No-Ticket Confirmation: If no open tickets exist, the workflow posts a ‚Äú‚úÖ No open tickets‚Äù message to Slack ‚Äî keeping teams informed of a clear queue.

## üß† Key Features
 ‚è±Ô∏è Automated SLA tracking and escalation
 üìä Real-time logging to Google Sheets
 ‚ö° Hourly auto-trigger ‚Äî no manual checks needed
 üì¢ Slack alerts at warning and critical thresholds
 üîÑ Dynamic Zendesk ticket updates via API

## üíº Use Cases
 üí¨ Proactively manage customer support SLAs
 üö® Automatically escalate critical tickets before breach
 üìà Maintain transparent SLA compliance reporting
 üì¢ Keep your support team updated in real time

## üì¶ Required Integrations
Zendesk API ‚Äì for ticket retrieval and updates
Slack API ‚Äì for alert notifications
Google Sheets ‚Äì for compliance and reporting logs

## üéØ Why Use This Template?
 ‚úÖ Prevent SLA breaches before they happen
 ‚úÖ Automate escalation and communication
 ‚úÖ Provide real-time visibility to support leads
 ‚úÖ Build a historical SLA performance dataset

parameters.content:
‚è∞ WORKFLOW START

This workflow monitors Zendesk tickets and ensures SLAs are met by:

‚Ä¢ Running every hour automatically
‚Ä¢ Fetching all open tickets
‚Ä¢ Calculating time remaining
‚Ä¢ Escalating tickets nearing breach
‚Ä¢ Logging compliance metrics
‚Ä¢ Alerting team via Slack

üì• ZENDESK DATA RETRIEVAL

Fetches all tickets from Zendesk:
‚Ä¢ Uses Zendesk REST API
‚Ä¢ Retrieves all records (returnAll: true)
‚Ä¢ Returns: ticket ID, status, created_at, sla_due, priority

Required ticket fields:
‚úì created_at (ISO timestamp)
‚úì sla_due (ISO timestamp)
‚úì id (unique identifier)
‚úì priority (low/medium/high/urgent)

üîç OPEN TICKET FILTER

Filters results to include only:
‚úì Tickets with status = 'open'

Rejected:
‚úó Closed tickets
‚úó On-hold tickets
‚úó Pending tickets

Only open tickets need SLA monitoring

parameters.text: ‚úÖ No open tickets at this time

parameters.content:
‚úÖ NO TICKETS ALERT

Sent when no open tickets found:
‚Ä¢ Channel: general-information
‚Ä¢ Confirms all tickets resolved
‚Ä¢ Provides status update

Helps team stay informed of workload status

‚è±Ô∏è SLA CALCULATION

For each ticket, calculates:

1. Total SLA Duration:
   slaTotal = sla_due - created_at

2. Time Remaining:
   timeRemainingMs = sla_due - now
   timeRemainingMinutes = timeRemainingMs / 60000

3. Percentage Elapsed:
   percentElapsed = (1 - remaining/total) √ó 100
   Range: 0-100%

Outputs added to ticket data:
‚úì percentElapsed
‚úì timeRemainingMinutes

string.name: note
string.value: Auto-prioritised due to SLA nearing breach

parameters.content:
üö® ESCALATION PAYLOAD

Prepares data for high-urgency tickets:

Sets priority to: 'High'
Adds note: 'Auto-prioritised due to SLA nearing breach'

This payload is sent to:
‚Üí Update Zendesk ticket
‚Üí Triggers automation rules
‚Üí Notifies support team

Used for 90%+ elapsed tickets

üî¥ CRITICAL THRESHOLD

Condition: percentElapsed ‚â• 90%

Means:
‚Ä¢ 90% of SLA time consumed
‚Ä¢ Only ~10% time remaining
‚Ä¢ Ticket at risk of breach
‚Ä¢ CRITICAL priority

Action: Route to escalation & Zendesk update

üü° WARNING THRESHOLD

Condition: percentElapsed ‚â• 75%

Means:
‚Ä¢ 75% of SLA time consumed
‚Ä¢ ~25% time remaining
‚Ä¢ Ticket needs attention
‚Ä¢ WARNING level

Action: Send warning message to Slack for team awareness

üîÑ ZENDESK UPDATE (75%+)

Updates ticket in Zendesk:
‚Ä¢ Uses ticket ID for targeting
‚Ä¢ Sets priority to 'High'
‚Ä¢ Adds internal note
‚Ä¢ Triggers Zendesk automations

Next: Routes to both escalation and warning branches

üö® ZENDESK UPDATE (90%+)

Updates ticket in Zendesk:
‚Ä¢ Uses escalation payload
‚Ä¢ Sets priority to 'High'
‚Ä¢ Adds breach warning note
‚Ä¢ May trigger escalation rules

Action: Notifies support to take immediate action

‚ö†Ô∏è SLACK WARNING ALERT

Sends to: general-information channel

Contains:
‚Ä¢ Ticket ID
‚Ä¢ Time remaining
‚Ä¢ Percentage of SLA elapsed
‚Ä¢ Priority level
‚Ä¢ Action required

Triggers for 75%+ elapsed tickets
Keeps team informed of at-risk tickets

üìä COMPLIANCE LOGGING

Prepares audit log for each ticket:

Data points:
‚úì Ticket ID
‚úì Percentage elapsed
‚úì Time remaining (minutes)
‚úì Timestamp (ISO)

Purpose:
‚Ä¢ Compliance tracking
‚Ä¢ SLA history
‚Ä¢ Audit trail
‚Ä¢ Reporting metrics

Stored in Google Sheets for analysis

üìà GOOGLE SHEETS LOGGING

Appends compliance records to:
Sheet: "Stripe Data" (Sheet1)

Columns recorded:
‚Ä¢ ticket_id
‚Ä¢ percent_elapsed
‚Ä¢ time_remaining_minutes
‚Ä¢ timestamp

Used for:
‚úì Historical analysis
‚úì Compliance reports
‚úì SLA trending
‚úì Team metrics

parameters.functionCode:
// Append a simple compliance log object to output for later storage or aggregation
return items.map(i => ({ json: { id: i.json.id, percentElapsed: i.json.percentElapsed, timeRemainingMinutes: i.json.timeRemainingMinutes, timestamp: new Date().toISOString() } }));

user.name: Rahul Joshi
user.bio: Rahul Joshi is a seasoned technology leader specializing in the n8n automation tool and AI-driven workflow automation. With deep expertise in building open-source workflow automation and self-hosted automation platforms, he helps organizations eliminate manual processes through intelligent n8n ai agent automation solutions.

data.details: The Cron node uses Cron under the hood - a time-based job scheduler in Unix-like computer operating systems. Use this node when you want to trigger workflows periodically, especially in more complex scenarios like "every Tuesday at 9 am" or "Weekdays".

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.
